column1: Starting October 1st visitors will NOT need a test result showing negative results within the last 5 days. Instead visitors will be randomly picked for a simple prick test. Also anyone with the virus will have insurance covered by the country of the Dominican Republic paying all expenses including the cost of changing airfare if needed because of the virus.

I also think it is great news. I had no problem testing and I still would not but the 5 day PCR test was not easily attainable for many. If you had a Wednesday or Thursday departure you were in a very tough spot because you cannot overnight on the weekends. I arrive on Thanksgiving Day and was very concerned about being able to meet the requirement. The metal detector analogy is silly. You can travel on an airplane right now within the US without a test. You cannot travel without passing through a metal detector. To each their own on comfort level and willingness to travel in these times. No situation will please all and I believe the DR President is trying to responsibly save their economy.
@RJP exactly! They need to test everyone at the departure city not at an arrival airport! If positive you stay home, why test in DR for instance randomly and potentially miss an infected passenger?
For those who believe testing is a must on arrival in the DR, I would be curious to find out how many have tested positive since the entry testing requirement came into effect.

I just got back from Punta Cana two weeks ago. The airport uses infared to check for temperatures, everything at the resorts are being sanitized from transportation, to bags to rooms etc. Everyone is wearing a mask and I felt fully protected. The only change that was made since that trip was the unrealistic 5 day old test requirement needed to enter the Country. This requirement was not working and was dropped. They will still randomly pull people aside for testing and certainly flag anyone with a fever who shouldn't have been traveling to begin with.

As much as we are itching to book our trip to PC and use our credit voucher from this past March...we are waiting on January before we start to even think about it. It’s hard to know about the second surge, and if countries are already relaxing their “rules” now, who knows what is going to happen in a worst case scenario. If the vaccine is invented by then...BONUS! Not holding our breath yet...but all fingers and toes are already crossed.Edited: 3:50 pm, August 26, 2020

Me being a positive guy, new cases in the last 24 hrs , 340, lowest # since July 7th. Active cases down 700+ in last 24 hrs. Active cases down 12 straight days. Again, numbers are numbers but they are seemingly trending in the right direction.

National Laboratory did not process PCR tests on Tueday due to technical problems.The National Laboratory Doctor Defilló did not process PRC samples this Tuesday due to technical problems, according to the Ministry of Public Health.In this sense, the entity establishes that yesterday only private laboratories issued results.According to the epidemiological report issued this Wednesday, in the last 24 hours, 2,585 samples were processed, of which 340 were positive."Due to technical problems at the Dr. Defilló National Laboratory, today only the results of samples processed by private laboratories are presented," states bulletin # 160.The Minister of Public Health, Plutarco Arias, admitted on Tuesday that there is a bottleneck in terms of the delivery of the results of the COVID-19 tests that have been carried out on the population.In the country, 355,839 PCR tests have been carried out, which have ruled out 263,282 cases and confirmed 92,557 infections.At the beginning of August the deputy director of the laboratory, Golber Atis, reported that their facilities can process 2,500 tests per day, however, they receive around 5,000 samples, which generates delays in the delivery of results.Source - Diario Libre.Angie.
